Identity of Target System.statement: `prompt-box` (pb) is a safety-first command gate for terminal use, invoked via the `pb` command, focused on eliminating shell injection risks.
prompt-box is not a general shell, command-line interpreter, or automation tool and does not provide implicit shell features such as pipes, redirects, globbing, or script execution.

Purpose & Jobs-to-be-done.statement: prompt-box is designed to prevent accidental or malicious execution of pasted shell commands by requiring explicit review and/or confirmation before running.

prompt-box inspects and classifies pasted or input shell commands, presents a plan and classification (ALLOW / REVIEW / BLOCK), and supports interactive dry runs and safe execution after explicit 'YES' confirmation.

Capability Map.statement: prompt-box reads commands from stdin for processing.
prompt-box can read commands from the clipboard using the `pb clip` subcommand (usage inferred from documentation).
prompt-box classifies input commands by safety level.
prompt-box supports ALLOW / REVIEW / BLOCK classifications for commands.
prompt-box outputs a plan prior to execution for each input command.
prompt-box requires interactive confirmation with a YES prompt before executing commands via `pb run`.
Only commands classified as ALLOW are executed by prompt-box.
prompt-box logs execution audit receipts as JSON files in the receipts directory.

Architecture Snapshot.statement: The main interface for prompt-box is a Bash script called 'pb'.
prompt-box is installed globally by symlinking the executable bash script to /usr/local/bin.
prompt-box receives commands via stdin or optionally via clipboard for checking and classification.
prompt-box provides an execution audit trail as JSON per run in the receipts directory.

How to Use the Target System.statement: Installation requires a Unix-like shell, ability to run bash scripts, sudo access for global install, and ln utility for creating a symlink.
How to Use the Target System.section: How to Use the Target System

How to Use the Target System.statement: No explicit configuration files or environment variables are required for prompt-box operation.
How to Use the Target System.section: How to Use the Target System

How to Use the Target System.statement: After installation, users can classify commands with `pb check` or interactively execute with `pb run`, confirming with 'YES' when prompted.
How to Use the Target System.section: How to Use the Target System

Integration Surface.statement: prompt-box writes execution receipts as JSON files inside the receipts directory, detailing tool, timestamp, cwd, and command results.
There is no evidence of prompt-box exposing APIs, webhooks, SDKs, or network/service integration points.

Data & Security Posture.statement: prompt-box stores audit logs locally as JSON receipts in the receipts/ directory.
Receipts/output data is not committed to version control by policy.
prompt-box never interprets or expands shell metacharacters, does not support pipes, redirects, or globbing, and uses shlex.split() for argument parsing.
Execution of commands requires explicit user confirmation, by typing 'YES' interactively for the run operation.

Operational Reality.statement: A writable receipts/ directory is required for audit logging and normal operation.
Installing prompt-box globally requires write/sudo access to /usr/local/bin for proper symlinking.

Maintainability & Change Risk.statement: prompt-box is script-based, single-file, and easy to deploy or update by replacing the pb script and resymlinking as needed.
prompt-box has no documented external dependencies and is designed to be environment-agnostic.
Changing the semantics for ALLOW/REVIEW/BLOCK classification or adding pipes, redirects, or globbing introduces high risk according to threat model notes.

_notes.routes: not_implemented: requires AST/regex route extractor over source files
_notes.dependencies: not_implemented: requires lockfile parser (package-lock.json, requirements.txt, etc.)
_notes.enforcement: not_implemented: requires auth/middleware pattern detector over source files

unknowns.description: Whether TLS/SSL is terminated and how (reverse proxy, load balancer, application-level)
unknowns.notes: No matching infrastructure/config artifacts found in file index
unknowns.resolve_with: Add TLS config: k8s Ingress with tls section, nginx.conf with ssl_certificate, Caddyfile with tls directive, or Terraform aws_acm_certificate resource

unknowns.description: Whether data at rest is encrypted (database, file storage, backups)
unknowns.notes: No matching infrastructure/config artifacts found in file index
unknowns.resolve_with: Add encryption config: Terraform aws_db_instance with storage_encrypted=true, k8s StorageClass with encrypted parameters, or pgcrypto extension usage

unknowns.description: How secrets/credentials are stored, rotated, and accessed at runtime
unknowns.notes: No matching infrastructure/config artifacts found in file index
unknowns.resolve_with: Add secret management: k8s ExternalSecret/SealedSecret manifests, Vault agent config, or Terraform vault_generic_secret resources

unknowns.description: Production deployment architecture (containers, VMs, serverless, regions)
unknowns.notes: No matching infrastructure/config artifacts found in file index
unknowns.resolve_with: Add deployment artifacts: Dockerfile, docker-compose.yml, k8s Deployment manifests, Terraform main.tf, Helm Chart.yaml, or fly.toml

unknowns.description: Identity and access management at runtime (service accounts, role-based access)
unknowns.notes: No matching infrastructure/config artifacts found in file index
unknowns.resolve_with: Add IAM config: k8s ServiceAccount/RBAC manifests, Terraform aws_iam_role resources, or OPA policy files

unknowns.description: Where application and infrastructure logs are collected and retained
unknowns.notes: No matching infrastructure/config artifacts found in file index
unknowns.resolve_with: Add logging config: Fluentd/Logstash config files, k8s logging sidecar manifests, or Terraform CloudWatch log group resources

unknowns.description: Whether monitoring/alerting is configured (health checks, uptime, error rates)
unknowns.notes: No matching infrastructure/config artifacts found in file index
unknowns.resolve_with: Add monitoring config: Prometheus rules YAML, Grafana dashboard JSON, k8s ServiceMonitor manifests, Terraform CloudWatch alarm resources, or Sentry config

unknowns.description: Backup strategy, frequency, and retention policy for data stores
unknowns.notes: No matching infrastructure/config artifacts found in file index
unknowns.resolve_with: Add backup config: Terraform aws_backup_plan resources, k8s CronJob backup manifests, or pg_dump/mongodump cron scripts with retention

unknowns.description: Where data is physically stored and whether data residency requirements are met
unknowns.notes: No matching infrastructure/config artifacts found in file index
unknowns.resolve_with: Add residency config: Terraform provider region constraints, k8s node affinity with topology labels, or documented data residency policy

rci_reporting_completeness.label: RCI — Reporting Completeness
rci_reporting_completeness.interpretation: Composite completeness of PTA reporting. NOT a security or structural visibility score.

dci_v1_claim_visibility.label: DCI_v1_claim_visibility
dci_v1_claim_visibility.interpretation: Percent of claims with deterministic hash-verified evidence. This is claim-evidence visibility, NOT system surface visibility.

dci_v2_structural_visibility.label: DCI_v2_structural_visibility (not implemented)
dci_v2_structural_visibility.interpretation: Structural surface visibility (routes/deps/schemas/enforcement). Not yet implemented — requires dedicated structural extractors.
